data.title: Depends on the Day!
data.text: this location has serious staffing issues! If they have a visiting manager- you're good to go.. otherwise.. its hit or miss. food quality is never an issue.. its just the timeliness of the staff. Cleanliness is also an issue, when they are short handed. Drive thru may be the way to go!

data.title: NO Bueno
data.text: Terrible service. I tried to ask questions and the kid that was waiting on me interrupted me constantly and would not let me ask the questions.  When he repeated the order the complete order was wrong.  I would suggest removing this guy from the personal contact area. Maybe best making the food, instead of human interaction.

data.title: Poor Management
data.text: We were here on Cinco De Mayo. IF there was a manager on duty, you would not have known it. The lobby was dirty, there was salsa all over the floor and it appeared to be only three people trying to run the entire restaurant. Not the first time service has been poor. The time prior we were asked "what do you want"? when we pulled up to the drive thru to order. I think we will try something else for awhile.

data.title: Fat food mexican
data.text: Taco Bueno is probably the better fast food Mexican . Although all are pretty mediocre. Fast service and ecomomical.

data.title: We love their guacamole!
data.text: My kids love Taco Bueno. It's close to work and school, and the prices are affordable. We especially like their chips and guac, but lots of the food is delicious.

data.title: Worst Taco Bueno, but we still go
data.text: This is probably the worst run restaurant that I frequent.  Why do we go? That's a very good question and our son asks it regularly.  The food is generally acceptable, but rarely are you given the right thing.  My advice - check your order, check it again.  It has been a bit better lately, but this tired old restaurant needs an update.

data.title: was better when it was a training store
data.text: I use to work here at this place back when it was a training store. I've always enjoyed the food but since it stopped being a training store I've seen the customer service plummet. I still eat there occasionally but I'm always disappointed in customer service. The staff dress poorly and on several occasions they messed up our order.

data.title: Nothing special
data.text: My first and only time eating at a Taco Bueno was unrewarding.  I like trying new Mexican places when I travel so this fit the bill.  Several cars were in the parking lot during lunch so I took that as a good sign.  I ordered a couple tacos and a burrito ('the usual').  They weren't bad, they just weren't 'good' - nothing about them really stood out.  The ground beef was uniquely seasoned but not all that flavorful.  The service was great - the person taking my order and the on-duty manager were both chatty and cordial so that was good but the quality and taste of the food were only so-so at best for me.

data.title: I am prejudiced, I love Taco Bueno!
data.text: What ever they use to make their food, I like it!  Sometimes things are a little too salty, but I like everything they make, from chips and salsa to the meals. Their meals are not quite as good as a "real sit down and order" Mexican restaurant, but for the price and speed it works. Their dessert could use a little work, but not complaining.  Very inexpensive, quick, easy, a place I stop at often,a late night snacking favorite.

data.title: Bad.
data.text: I ordered online from Taco Bueno today and went and picked up my food. It was ready as soon as I got there, no waiting involved. That's the best part of my experience with Taco Bueno in Ardmore oklahoma... I ordered the Sour Cream Chillada platter. The "Chillada's" were cold and the tortillas were tough and rubbery. The rice was dry and partially undercooked. I also ordered 2 burritos (one of which I didn't receive...) The meat in the "B O B" was ground to the point of nearly being a paste but despite it's consistency it still managed to be gristly. I could only describe it as dog food. Like my "Chillada", it came cold and the tortilla was tough and rubbery. I have had good experiences with Taco Bueno before and I hate to give them a bad review but unfortunately... the food I received was unacceptable...

data.title: Definitely the best Mexican Fast Food
data.text:
As far as Mexican fast food fare, Taco Bueno is definitely the best. They do need to give more chips with the Mexi Dips and Chips (or go down in price) and go back to the better cheese sauce they used to have, but it is the only place with real salsa given right at the window...as many as you request and it can be purchased in a large cup cheap, too. You can also get jalapeños and chopped onions on request as well as a different salsa.

The tacos have real meat as opposed to Taco Bell, who uses some sort of meat soup...yuck!

data.title: Stale, greasy chips
data.text: I asked to substitute queso for the rice on my Chilada Platter and got charged $1.50 for it without being told it was extra.  The queso cup was only 1/2 full and watered down.  The chips were not only greasy but also stale.  We won't eat there again.

data.title: Horrible
data.text:
The crew members are rude,the restaurant is filthy and the food is always cold ,the chips are very stale and non-chewable
One day I found a fly baked in my chip

data.title: Good food, cheap prices
data.text: There are plenty of choices on this fast food menu. Small or big items, for kids or adults. The food is good.

data.title: This place has no quality control...
data.text: Used to be my favorite place in town.  Recent years it has gone downhill. My husband refuses to eat there. They CONSTANTLY mess up orders & last time he got sick. The drive thru slings the food together/you open your box to a soppy mess. I went for breakfast. Only 2 cars in line; I stupidly think they could make 1 burrito & didn't check it. WRONG!  Realized my mistake when I got home. I called to complain. The "manager" is who took my order & handed it to me. He mumbled sorries but was otherwise useless. I asked for a supervisor's contact info & was given a bogus phone number! Never going back!

data.title: Mom good!
data.text: Besides the limited space for parking during the busy lunch rush, this is my favorite place to go. I visit it once or twice a week for their tacos and burritos. Their number 2, nacho salad is very good too.

data.title: New bowls are amazing!
data.text: They have these new Bueno bowls that you can get with rice or lettuce like a salad. Have not done the lettuce one, but the rice one with chicken is really yummy! You get to customize what all you want on it. I reccomend the rice with chicken, black beans, corn, pico, and cheese!

data.title: Quick Mex
data.text: Good quick inexpensive food. Ate there two days ago.

data.title: If you like terrible service and stale food, this is the place for you!
data.text:
I love Taco Bueno but this particular location has consistently proven itself to be VERY underwelming in terms of service and quality.

It is not uncommon to have something missing from your oder and it's quite common to have hard, stale tortillas as part of your meal.  It also takes forever to actually receive your order.

I've lived in Edmond for three years now and this particular location has been badly in need of new management for all of that time.

data.title: Great for a quick drive thru
data.text: Food is great, service is o.k.; however management needs to stress the importance of clean tables and floors.  Otherwise, I would have given a 5 on everything.
